TopicTitle: [It's finally here!] Apollo Replica "MUNBUG XII" Saturn V, CSM, Lander, Buggy

Articles.Content: awesome. Just Awesome

awesome. Just Awesome

Thanks!... Munbug VI will be even better. Made some progress already but holding back for 0.20 as there is likely to be a new lander can in the patch.

Thanks!... Munbug VI will be even better. Made some progress already but holding back for 0.20 as there is likely to be a new lander can in the patch.

This?

This?

Yep. I've already been playing around with the original mod version. It is in the KSPX expansion mod by Claira (who is making the official versions now) along with the original of the other pod coming in 0.20. Holding off playing about with them too much yet though as I suspect the dimensions have changed on the new official versions.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-18-4-kspx-parts-expansion/

... Munbug VI ... i guess i should start working on my Tanis-Program again.

i have to say, that i realyl want to look over your shoulder Mulbin, when you are working in the VAB and testing the stuff you build. just shot the Jool V into orbit some minites ago and it was ... awesome.

edit:

reverse engienering is something great. i really wondered about the fueltanks of your Jool V ... and you did the same thing i had in mind for my Tanis IV Munrocket. i only have to figure out a good enigecluster, cause i dont want to spam Mainsails

your Munlander is relly pretty. such a nice lander, how much time did you spent on designing the lander?

Must say, the ship looks beautiful. Sad I never got one of the Munbugs into the mun

Hey Mulbin, where the heck did u build your Jool V? Outside ???

I'm try to build SpaceX's Falcon Heavy to carry space station parts into orbit, but the VAB isn't tall enough! Seeing your Jool V is even longer, how did u do it???

Thx

Steffen
Ridiculously good looking.

Wow, good job, but so, so OTT XD I love it!

EDIT: I tried it out, and it melts my CPU XD (I have a stock i7-2600 @ 3.4 GHz)

Edited May 26, 2013 by rexrex600

In the final test and tweak stage of Munbug VI ! Will release tomorrow. It has a new eagle lander that blows munbug V out of the water... completely new build based very closely on the Apollo lander.

A teaser pic!... the view from Futility Base.

I must say that is one sexy looking lander! It looks just like the real thing.

What's the part count of the rocket sitting on the launchpad?

Edited May 29, 2013 by astropapi1

I must say that is one sexy looking lander! It looks just like the real thing.

You won't be saying that tomorrow when I release the new one It reeeeeeeaally looks like the real thing!

Another teaser! More pics and the craft file uploading tomorrow after testing.

I am super-excited, you have no idea.

UPDATE!!!!!

Have just updated the main post with Munbug VI. I think you'll agree the lander is even closer to the Apollo missions...

Once again I'm blown away by your design skills, Mulbin! Bravo!

beautifull lande Mulbin, very beautifull
OMG I'm Gonna Die mublin!!!! That is amazing *Download Commencing* :D
That is the most amazing lander I've ever seen!
WOW thats a hell of spaceship. The Jool V is pretty fascinating. I'm looking forward to the moment (far in the future) where i will also be able to bild awesome crafts like that.
Ok my first launch failed to reach orbit
What's the part count?
Ok this is the most fantastic stock craft iv ever seen on here, this is just a beautiful rocket and that lander .. OMG il never go to the mun in anything else again!

What's the part count?

*shuffles feet*... 712... Apologies if it breaks your computer! Bear in mind you will shed hundreds of parts by the time you are in orbit though.

I've just realised the staging might not be completely correct... rushing out a small update in the next couple of days to Munbug VII - basically VI but with some bug fixes but also an added feature!...

The MMSEP packages (Munbug Munar Surface Experiment Package) - 3 separate bits of surface equipment to help create the feel of an Apollo landing site!

In the mean time apologies for any trouble from staging!

Also if anyone is interested I can publish my flag - Star and Stripes of the U.S.K (as seen in pics).
